questions.question: You are a student with a B1 proficiency in English. Your class teacher will ask you a question. You should answer this question with the minimum of 80 words. What is the best book you've ever read and why?

answers.answer: One of the best books I've ever read is "To Kill a Mockingbird" by Harper Lee. It is a novel about a young girl named Scout Finch who grows up in a small town in the 1930s in the American South. The book explores themes of racial injustice, morality, and the loss of innocence. The story is told through Scout's eyes, giving readers a unique perspective on the events that unfold. The novel is powerful and thought-provoking, and it has had a lasting impact on me. I would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a well-written and thought-provoking book.
